Reviews.Title: What A Picture!WOW!
Reviews.Author: keeneye "navigator"
Reviews.Content: First off Do Not buy this TV for the Internet browsing feature ,that's  nice to have but only for the WIFI function.The 3D is great if you have a 3D-BluRay player.I won't bother you with the little details.The picture is spectacular.(and this is one 'Period' you can trust!)My set didn't require too many adjustments.I set the PICTURE to RESET and even though it defaults to STANDARD  I had to adjust the Brightness down  to 45.I also  set the ADVANCED PICTURE SETTING  to RESET.Now,and this was crucial for my TV :you need to turn  the Eco Setting 'Light Sensor'to "OFF" This made  the biggest difference in picture quality and enjoyment.I read the other reviews,settings etc.but only the above worked for me.I'm still playng with the Sound,it sounds great on SD,but on HD I need to turn the volume up.I don't have/own a sound bar.On a minor PLUS  note, my old remote for a Sony KDF50E2000 works well  with  this tv,and on a minor MINUS note,it is annoyng  that the INPUT  display doesn't stay on  long enough  as you rush to the  up/down arrows(  they seem to be miles apart)...  I guess you'll find  out!I'm glad I decided on this set.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, must buy for gaming!
Reviews.Author: Jake Buckley
Reviews.Content: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! This TV.  I was in the market for a new TV for my PS4.  The TV I wanted was going to be completely dedicated to gaming.  After doing much research I found that one of the other Sony models was rated the best in terms of input lag however, they were selling it in the awkward 47" size.  This TV was next on my list and I have absolutely no regrets.3D:I don't believe that 3D is the future.  I still believe this is a gimmick to boost prices on blu-rays and going to the movies and I don't see any value in having 3D.  That said, I neglected the fact that this was a 3D TV.  Once I opened the box I was surprised to see the glasses in the box.  They were stashed away for the first 2 weeks I had the TV, then I decided to check it out.  WOW, it's actually pretty darn good.  I'm impressed with the depth and the comfort of the 4 glasses it comes withGaming:This is a great TV for any gamer.  The PS4 and Xbox 360 I currently have hooked up to it look remarkable.  These consoles were hooked up to a Samsung I purchased earlier this year and looked great, but hooked into this TV they looked phenomenal.  Sony uses some great smoothing technology that really makes the graphics and text pop.If you are looking for a new TV that can be used for gaming, I HIGHLY recommend this TV.  One of the best ones I've owned.  I have always had Samsung in the past and this was my first Sony.  I wouldn't be surprised if I purchase a Sony television from this point on.  Very happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Color settings needs tweaking.
Reviews.Author: Emre Aydinceren
Reviews.Content: I am comparing this TV to my older 7 year old 40 Sony XBR, picture quality not as good. I constantly found myself adjusting the display settings. Out of the box color settings to my eye were terrible, too much on the blue side and terrible contrast. Too vivid  and brightness cranked up to a point making people pale. I lowered brightness but increased backlight, set the black correlator to medium Viewing angle also has an effect on the color. Blu-ray, Netflix and Amazon video quality is great and overall this is a good TV, I would buy it again. It doesn't have VGA or DVI input, but 4 HDMI input will substitute.

Reviews.Title: KDL-60R550A
Reviews.Author: armando cortez
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV a few days ago and it is amazing.  There are a ton of settings that I still havent had time to adjust however with the default settings I have no complaints so far.  The only issue I have is the lag in response time when using the remote and connecting to the internet could be a little quicker.  3D movies look great on this tv and he kiddos are in love with all the CGI animation movies we have watched on it (wreck it ralph, brave, despicable me, GI Joe).  The free year of netflix and hulu make this deal even sweeter.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Judy Johnson
Reviews.Content: This TV is Awesome. I replaced an LG with this Sony and the picture is perfect. No motion blur, and the motion is not all weird like on the LG. There are several picture mode options from auto to cinema to sports. It is a smart TV and has the Sony Entertainment Network. I recently discovered that Sony gives you a 1 YEAR Free Subscription to Netflix And Hulu Plus when you buy this tv. There was also a free 30 day music unlimited trial.  And best of all there IS an Amazon Video App built in to this TV.  For the free Sony offers you need to go into the apps (SEN) section, select the app and follow the instructions to get your free subscription, but it was not difficult at all to get or set up. The receiverless directv part isn't all that great, you Must have the new Genie receiver to go receiverless. If anyone has directv you then know that you are only eligible for and equipment upgrade according to your agreement or have to pay full price for the equipment.  I am going to wait for my eligibility then go receiverless.  I also purchased a new Sony BluRay and the Sony Sync function on the TV worked perfectly, now when the bluray is turned on the input is automatically changed. I highly recommend Sony HDTV's, they are well worth a bit of extra money. Oh...and the sound is Great for a HDTV, doesn't sound canny at all. I still need more bass so have also purchased the Sony DAVTZ140 home theater that Did Not break the Bank at All.  Maybe TV manufacturers should just sell subwoffers along with the TV's???

Reviews.Title: Beautiful...just beautiful
Reviews.Author: Nerd Herd
Reviews.Content: After my BRAND SPANKING NEW Samsung UN60ES8000 failed on me (see my review on that set if you're interested), I decided to try out this model. Oh dear lord is this an awesome tv. It's not going to win any awards for the best form factor since sliced bread, but the sheer screen size and beautiful picture is something you must see for yourself. I purchased the 70" model of this tv and couldn't be happier. It's a bit heavy at 60 or 65 lbs or so, but it's wall mounted to my articulating mount safely and securely. I still need to calibrate many of the settings, but for the average Joe, the three standard settings are plenty good.In case some of you are gamers with Xbox 360s, be aware that you may have an "OH NO!" moment when the tv blacks out after your 360 starts a game/movie, but this is due to the tv's auto picture control not communicating with the system. I simply turned this automatic feature off and voila...no problems.  (I somehow suspect Sony did this purposely, lol)Oh yeah, and the 3D is cool I guess, but not really a fan of that stuff. The fact that this is passive 3D makes me happier than my previous tv with battery-powered glasses, but the fact of the matter is I won't truly adopt 3D until there are holograms in my living room and I don't need to wear glasses.Anyway, back to topic...purchase this tv...at any size...with confidence.

Reviews.Title: It's a Sony.
Reviews.Author: Amel
Reviews.Content: I will start with one  "problem"After using this 70 inch TV, my 47 inch LG looks so small. So probably from now on it's 70 for me, since all other look small!Visually it is stunning, the stand, thin bezel, slim profile. It will look perfect in any space.Picture quality out of the box is poor, I was almost disappointed. But you can adjust picture in so many ways, that you're bound to get it just right for your taste. Sony people have such a bad taste when they set up preset picture settings. After tweaking with settings I am more than pleased with picture quality. 3D is great, mostly due to the size of the screen.Sound quality is above average, but when you buy something this good, spend some more money and get a sound bar.Connectivity is good, I like the default Netflix button on the remote.Overall I am very pleased with this TV, Sony brand means that it will last some time, and be trouble free.I recommended buying it if you can, especially with these prices.

Reviews.Title: Was expected a little more
Reviews.Author: mouse
Reviews.Content: Picture at times seems a little washout. Refresh rate is pretty obvious. Tv jumps too quickly from 3d function back to 2d without your control. I am not certain if it is a problem with Amazon, Netflix or Comcast but movies keep stopping and drag in on 3d mode, could be a internet problem.however i am supplied with 26.68mbps (just made a check).I was expecting more from  a Sony product . I have seen similar  product look much better,and cost less.The product arrived late and the seller was not accommodative with tracking informations. Made special effort to circumvent a longer delivery date and the product was there for delivery.The shipper did not lived up to the promised instructions from amazon. Even when they were shown the clear and expected standards from amazon,they walked out and said"its not my job".

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-70R550A 70-Inch 120Hz 1080p - Simply Awesome
Reviews.Author: Raj
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on any website and I wanted to do this just because I was so impressed by my first impression on this TV were simply AWESOME!!. To be sure this is my third TV in last 2 months were in I went from Samsung 65 LED to Samsung 65 Plasma. The quality was just not there on Samsung TV's after spending 2k so had to return them back. I was very hesitant in buying this TV as I already had 2 bad experience with Samsung TV, but after reading the reviews on this TV I thought of taking a chance and boy did that work for me. If you are search for a TV with Great Picture Quality, Brilliant 3D and class styling this is it for you. I have not done any calibration just out box the picture quality is so good I just don't have words to describe them.. So if you are on the side line and deciding between Samsung and Sony. Samsung just pales in comparison it is just no were near SONY.

Reviews.Title: A 3D skeptic sees the light!
Reviews.Author: jce3
Reviews.Content: We have had 3 other HDTVs prior to purchasing this Sony. A 32" Philips LCD, a 42" Philips LCD with Ambilight (still have it and works great!), and a 52" 240Hz Samsung LCD, still have this one too.I have been looking for something slightly larger like a 60" HDTV for months, doing online customer satisfaction, expert reviews, etc. I found the reviews on this set to be unusually high, especially for an LCD HDTV. We bought it at Sears because I felt if I buy local and have an issue, it'll be easier to return.We got it home, unboxed, installed stand and turned it on. All I can say is this Sony has unbelievable picture quality! I used a THX setup disc and using the standard video setting, it needed very little tweaking.For years I have ignored 3D TVs as a dying fad, and who knows maybe it is. But I do have a couple 3D blu rays simply because the combo editions were the same price as without. So thinking maybe someday down the road...Anyway, I put in the Avengers 3D blu ray and WOW. Crisp clear image, like looking through the old 3D viewfinders! My wife was actually ducking a few times! This is Sony's newest 3D technology that uses simple passive glasses. No batteries, no charging, and no high cost when buying more! It comes with 4 pair which should be enough for an average family.So I am a skeptic no more! Now I have read other reviews on certain brands of HDTVs and the 3D rendering is sub-par. But I can assure anyone that this TV has it all.Oh yeah, standard HD and SD looks great too!Do NOT hesitate to pull the trigger on purchasing this TV, you will not be disappointed!Oh, by the way...I have since ordered about 10 "3D blu rays" here on Amazon to replace several of my 2D discs.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from this one...wishing Amazon would take it back.
Reviews.Author: D. Kinney
Reviews.Content: We've had a terrible time with this TV. The day it was delivered the picture was having issues. Delivery guy offered to take the TV back with him, but I opted to keep it because we needed a TV that evening.  I called Amazon and requested a replacement be shipped.  The next morning the TV looked normal.  Three days later I wrote Amazon and requested they cancel the replacement TV since this one appeared to function as intended.  Five weeks later (of course) the picture on the left side starts going out, image is ghosting, screen flickering... Discovered that pressing on the back of the left side of the TV would correct the issue for several hours.  Now we are waiting for Sony to let us know how to proceed with repair service (since we are slightly past the Amazon return period).  Overall a bad experience. Wishing I had purchased the Samsung from Costco (return period is 60 days longer than Amazon!).Link to picture of TV screen (to show issue we're experiencing)[...]

Reviews.Title: Surprising! Looks Good!
Reviews.Author: Brian Bailey
Reviews.Content: I was tempted by Sony's new 65" 4K TV, but this TV costs 1/3 the price and is larger.  Well, I have set it up and adjusted it, and I'm very impressed!  At my viewing distance of 10.5 feet, the picture is impressive!  I certainly can not see pixels and I don't think I would have had any benefit from the 4K.  Haven't tried the passive 3D yet, but my kid is super excited about it.  The TV is sleek and simple, a huge black slab when off.  The picture is bright, good color accuracy.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Television, Great for Gamers and Movies
Reviews.Author: James L. Hodge
Reviews.Content: I am very familiar with Sony Televisions and I was looking to buy a 75" Samsung. The Samsung was my first Choice just becasue the picture was so vivid and bright. I was able to experiment with Samsungs at stores but could not find a 70" Sony to look at.  I could not afford the 3,400.00 Samsung and took my chances with the Sony 70" 3d Passive. I was not disappointed. This Sony is amazing and meets all my needs. If your a gamer. Than this is it for you! The picture is amazing. Bright and Vivid (I actually had to turn the brightness down.  I have a Sony Active 3d Television and I like the 3d Passive. The Passive 3d has no flicker and is very smooth in motion. Trust me folks, I love a great picture for games and movies and this tv does the job. I have not used the SMART TV options yet. I have enough other electronics for that and really don't need my tv for the other apps.  Hope this helps on your decisions out there. The market is tough so good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: Stop Reading Reviews and Buy This TV!!
Reviews.Author: Mike Messina
Reviews.Content: Awesome tv. Picture is great.  The 3D was the biggest surprise, it works better than any other 3D tv I have seen and with the small, cheap passive glasses.The only thing that stopped me from giving it a 5 star rating is the audio.  It sounds fine but you have to turn it almost 3/4 of the way to maximum to watch a movie. Small gripe for an otherwise amazing tv.  Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Sony rocks!
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Ever since the Trinitrons (you old folks will remember them), Sony has made the best TVs on the planet. I now have 3 of their HD tvs. I would not think of buying another brand.  Enough said.

Reviews.Title: We love this TV
Reviews.Author: Xavier
Reviews.Content: Not to big, not to small, delivered quickly, easy set-up, nice crisp image, audio could be better (as good as image) and acceptable price, After three months, I would buy it again!

Reviews.Title: I love this tv
Reviews.Author: Bill Grant
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and debated between Sony and Sumsung, but for the money is the best TV and best size/ Plus it has passive 3d and I think it is big plus

Reviews.Title: 3d is awesome
Reviews.Author: Harold Rogers
Reviews.Content: I bought the Sony Bravia because I am familiar wi the brand. I have another 40inch Bravia from 2005 and it still works perfectly and I expect this one to be the same. It's a great tv and the 3d is amazing. I get a true sense of happiness when I get to relax on my couch and watch my fav shows on this tv.

Reviews.Title: KDL-60R550A
Reviews.Author: Brenda watson
Reviews.Content: Love this TV...it does everything it was reported to do.  The internet browser is a little cumbersome but the picture, including the 3D is amazing.  Consumer reports was right, it is a really good buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, no regrets
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: I've had the 70" model for one month now and have no regrets. I upgraded from a Sanyo 55". Paid $2,299 for it from Best Buy and had it delivered from them. It has a great HD picture when watching blu ray movies or playing video games and I found the menus easy to navigate through. I followed someone else's review on here to manually set up the picture and then adjusted things slightly to where I thought they looked best. There are a few cons that, for the price, I feel should be better, but this TV does everything I want it to and fully meets my expectations, so I would buy the same thing again just knowing that. I use PS4/AppleTV for netflix, etc. so I didn't even set up the TV's wifi/netflix/other apps. I also didn't buy it for the 3D, but I tried it out and it's just fine. I still prefer just 1080p without 3D so don't expect any 3D miracles. If I could have been more specific, I think I would give this a 4.7 stars instead of just 4, but I didn't want to give the full 5. I plan to update this review in 6 months or so, and if anything bad happens I will post immediately.Cons (in order of most annoying):Glare: I have two lamps in the room and they aren't "in front" of the TV but this TV will have a lot of glare from lights and it can be very annoying when there's a dark scene in movie/TV show. This is the main reason it didn't get 5 stars.When I change input to PS4 from watching TV, the "sound mode" automatically changes to "game" which isn't the ideal mode when watching a movie on PS4, so I have to manually get the remote that came with the TV (I use a Tivo remote normally) and change the sound mode.When unpausing a show through Tivo, the sound is half of a second delayed to come back on and you end up missing a couple words. This may be my HDMI cable since I haven't noticed the problem with PS4 or AppleTV.Pizza effect: on a black screen, there is quite a bit of white light visible on the screen, but this isn't noticeable when watching TV unless the scene is very very dark.Weight of the TV. I'm not going to enjoy taking care of this when I move.UPDATE: 4 months later and everything is still as specified in my review.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Images and Convenient 3D
Reviews.Author: J A F
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Sony Bravia 55" LED 3D TV with active 3D for a few years, and I have been extremely happy with it.  I love the 3D format, but I found the active glasses to be a chore for the rest of my friends and family because of clumsy glasses that require charging/batteries, heavy weight, etc.It was time for an upgrade and a switch to passive 3D, and the KDL-70R550A does not disappoint  The HD picture is equally as beautiful as any high-end Sony TV.  Passive 3D doesn't have quite the "pop" as active 3D in my opinion, but the trade-off for lighter, cheaper glasses is well worth it.  We recently had 9 people watching a feature, and everyone was blown away.  That would be hard to do with active glasses.  I know I'll be watching more 3D because passive is just easier to use.  It's an excellent 3D experience, and I won't go back to active glasses ever again.I would recommend disabling the efficiency and light sensing features.  I saw a significant increase in picture quality.  I found the picture settings to be adequate, but I did make a few adjustments to backlighting and contrast to compete with a bright room.  Blacks are deep and colors are bright.  The picture is excellent on this set.  I thought the menus were easy to use, but I am familiar with Sony menus already.The overall size of the set is eye-popping.  People can't help but say "Wow!" when they first enter the room.  It's hard not to marvel at the experience of this TV in your home.I use most of the apps through my Sony Blu-ray players and Onkyo receiver, but I didn't experience any of the issues with connectivity of the TV.  I had a few small issues with HD signals out of the box, but everything was corrected with the software upgrade.Buy it.  You'll love it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Was skeptical about buying such a large tv, however once it arrive at our home, in a box large enough for 10 squirrels to live in, my feelings changed.  We mounted ours above our fireplace, where it fits very snug, and out comes off the wall about three inches.  Black sleek design, serves as a great picture frame when having events at our home.  All 3d and smart tv extras work wonders.  Netflix will always get old quick though.  HD football games are a ball.  Stock speakers however are NOT the greatest as expected.  Hooked up studio monitor speakers and all is better.  highly recommend, and make sure 70 inches fits where you plan on having it.  I am writing the review on the tv right now.  wahooo!

Reviews.Title: Fanfreakintastic! So nice I had to make a word splice.
Reviews.Author: Edward Hunter
Reviews.Content: This TV is wonderful in 3D and 2D, I have had it for a couple of months and the only thing I found a problem with was auto light sensor. I think my room gets to much random light from various sources, however after turning that off flashing stopped.As far as picture quality goes everyone has their own taste and I found that this TV met mine perfectly. I wish it had more then one timer, so I could have a weekend and weekday setting. I hope all those who have had a bad experience contact Sony, because they have great customer service. I can't say the same for Vizio, enough said.

Reviews.Title: Just Great
Reviews.Author: John E Hallinan
Reviews.Content: Tis SONY is the best TV I have ever bought . It works great, looks great and the company that sold me this TV went out of it's way in order to make me a happy customer .Thanks for the TV  and the great company I bought it from.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: DC Seaman
Reviews.Content: We really like out 70" Sony. Great picture and 3-D display. Super price on it and prompt delivery. Would not hesitate to buy from this seller again or hesitate to buy another Sony product. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Big size, Great Picture, and fast delivery......what more can someone ask for.
Reviews.Author: Mohamed Amin
Reviews.Content: If you want a Large LED/LCD TV that wont break the bank, then this is the TV for you.  Of course there are better quality TVs out there for $4000+, but I wouldn't pay that much

Reviews.Title: Beyond What I expected
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: For those rating this set below 4, don't blame shipping problems or vendor problems on the TV. I have used many sizes and types of TVs from Friends houses. Although I was not impressed when I saw this at HH Greg, all the TVs there of any size had the same issues with motion and ghost images. The Sony did a bit better than the others, but still was hoping the image was better. Read hundreds of reviews. The people rating it poor stated it came in damaged after they opened the box 6 months later. How can that be a Manufacture problem. When you buy it, always open and check it. Some people complained of a slow remote. The remote at the store was slow, but with out any 300 devices looking for or sending out commands, this TV preformed very well, not slow to me. Starting up the TV took a few extra seconds, IT IS A 70" MONSTER, what did you expect! The first 1080P movie I put up on was WOW, no motion issues, no ghosting images and that was on a Broadcast station. Like all remotes, they take time to get use to, after time I knew where each button was while in the dark. The Blacks/whites and colors stood off the screen. 3D was fantastic. The only thing I did not like about it was the stand. It is a U shaped stand, would have been better as a completed metal on all 4 sides. I chose the Bravia to match my other Bravia devices and Glad I did.If you was quality, great picture and a good price - This IS the TV you want.Do price shop though, as I found Best Buys was out of stock in their warehouse and all local stores. HH Greg had to order it in, and tried to get me to buy a different one, but beat Beat Buy price by $50. After looking at the box size and packing, I would not suggest having this shipped to you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent 70 inch TV
Reviews.Author: samurai30
Reviews.Content: 1)Picture quality (PQ): Overall, the PQ is quite impressive, especially for a mid tier 70 inch TV. PQ for any TV is impacted on the video source, but if you have a good quality video source from your cable or direct TV provider, you will not be disappointed. Blue ray PQ is outstanding. For watching sports, I recommend turning off MotionFlow. MotionFlow creates that "soap opera-effect". It may be good for movies (subjective), but causes blurring of rapid moving objects such as a hockey puck.3)Screen uniformity: No issues with blotches or light leakage that I can tell. I'm not an extreme videophille, so perhaps I just don't notice them.4)3D: Initially I was not a big fan of 3D TV, but Sony's incorporation of passive 3D technology creates an experience that is much more enjoyable for me. The glasses are comfortable. Even simulated 2D to 3D is pretty decent on this TV.5)Video games: I'm a casual gamer and I have had no issues that I have observed so far. This TV has been rated great for video games, see belowhttp://www.displaylag.com/introducing-2013s-best-hdtvs-for-gaming-part-1/6)Screen reflectiveness: My room has a lot of open windows. Luckily this TV has a "semi matte" screen, which helps reduce reflections. I was initially interested in the Sharp or Vizio 70 inch, which are full matte screens. But, I felt the PQ was somewhat diminished because of the full matte screens. I still enjoy watching Samsung TVs, but the highly reflective screens were not an option for me.7)Placement of TV: I am using the stand that accompanied the TV. It's not the best looking stand, just adequate, I wish it was black. I've read on other forums the stand caused their Sony R550A to lean back a bit. I haven't had any noticeable issues, but be aware of this.8)Viewing angles: As with most LED TVs, PQ is less optimal at increased viewing angles, and this holds true for this TV. I didn't notice increased viewing angles being better than other LED TVs of similar size on PQ.9)Price: I think the price of this TV is very competitive with the other 70 inch smart 3D TVs. I've heard great comments for both the Vizio and Sharp, but this Sony TV fit my needs a bit better.In summary, a great mid tier 70 inch LED TV that I am very happy with.

Reviews.Title: Looking for an excellent 3D TV...
Reviews.Author: Edmonson
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a good 3D TV for a while now. The 3D on this edge lit LED/LCD TV is as good as any I've seen. It also has very good uniformity compared to say the edge lit LG LM5850 which had strong hot spots in the corners, though it's not as good as a plasma for uniformity. For excellent 3D one needs high contrast and a bright screen and this one has those in a normally lit or somewhat dim room. Where this TV lets me down to some degree is when viewed in a dark room, and then the blacks don't appear very black at all even if one turns down the backlighting to zero. If one likes to watch movies in a darkened room then it might be best to look at a higher end TV, possibly a plasma, like the Panasonic ST, VT or ZT, or Samsung PNF8500, though except for the Panasonic ST one will have to pay two or three times more for these TVs. If one watches a lot of TV or sports where the images are usually quite bright then this likely wouldn't be an issue, but if one enjoys watching films like Prometheus, or Cabin in the Woods, then one might wish they had bought a TV with darker blacks. I also found that the tv screen was quite glossy and so reflected objects in front of the tv as compared to a mat finished LED/LCD screen, or a tv with anti-glare filters like the plasma Panasonic ST, VT, ZT or the Samsung PNF8500, which is also the best performing plasma in bright light conditions.Another thing I do like about this TV is the passive 3D, since it doesn't require battery operated glasses and one doesn't get the flicker one tends to get with the active glasses which is more common on the plasma TVs. Also this TV only weighs about 41 lbs and a plasma in a similar size would be about 50% heavier. The colors also appear very good on this TV and there are numerous settings in the menu for one to adjust. This TV is also a smart TV and  can hook up to the internet wirelessly. So if one wants a excellent 3D TV that is priced under $1000 then this might be the TV for you.With regards to black levels: one can push the dark levels a bit lower if one goes into the Advanced Settings and turns on the LED Motion Mode. As long as one has an overhead light, or standing lamp, with a variable light switch one can adjust the light in an otherwise dark room to get an excellent picture from this TV.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-70R550A 70-Inch 120Hz 1080p 3D Internet LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Victor Trang
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I've purchased a television online so of course I had to go with the trusted site like Amazon. The item arrived as promised and the gentleman that delivered the item brought it in and plugged it in to check to make sure it worked to my liking. I had it installed above my fireplace and man is this thing huge. Everyone that has seen the TV thinks it's huge. I must say that this TV is worth every dollar spent. The picture quality is clear and the 3D is amazing. It comes with 4 pairs of passive glasses and it's pretty fun to movies in 3D. The 2D to 3D feature is OK. But I don't expect it to be mind blowing. The motion flow is pretty impressive but I already have a Sony with motion flow and wished this was 240Hz. But this TV can't be beat. I'm so glad I went for the 70" instead of the 65" or 60". It's not too heavy given the size of it. Also it comes with free NetFlix and Hulu Plus for a year! Can't beat that! The wifi is much better than other TVs and the apps on it are pretty solid. I would definitely recommend this to anyone that wants a quality TV for a decent price. You do definitely need external speakers for this because it's not as loud as you would want it to be. But this can be depending on the size of the room it is in. A simple sound bar and sub would suffice.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: E. Tucker
Reviews.Content: Long time lurker on this TV when I was in the market for a 70+ inch TV for my basement which was being finished. Ended up pulling the trigger on this one after reading many of the posts here and elsewhere. Ordered it from Amazon back in June and it was ready to be delivered the last week in June. However, delays in my basement project forced me to have the shipping company hold it in their warehouse for 3 weeks! Ended up getting the TV delivered in late July but didn't get it installed until literally last night. And man, it's only been a day and a half, but all of the waiting for this TV was absolutely worth it!  I found the website called whatsthemodel.com very helpful for comparing and deciphering model numbers of major TV brands.I'm no videophile, but my frame of reference are the two plasma TVs I own - a 50" Panasonic and a 42" Samsung. What I couldn't get over was just how spectacular the picture is on this TV out of the box! I only started to dabble with the settings today, but popping in my Avengers Bluray last night for a quick check proved to be the best moment of the night! This TV is BIG - I mean, it is one massive wall eater! I have this bad boy mounted on my wall!Cable in HD on channels like ESPN, HBO, etc. look fantastic.  I'm still messing with settings to get the perfect mix, but so far, so good!  I can confidently say that both DVDs, Blurays and video games also look absolutely incredible on this TV.I watched a 3D Bluray (Star Trek Into the Darkness) and all I can say is WOW. I always thought 3D was a gimmick, but all my movies will be 3D affairs from now on! The picture was absolutely stunning. I don't think watching regular TV in 3D will be practical but for movies, it's a no brainer, this is an must-see experience! For those concerned with gaming, this set does not disappoint. Gaming was great with no discernible lag - even for twitch-type games.I heavily considered the LG 60 here due to stellar reviews but ultimately opted for the extra screen size of the Sony.B00BB9OOLKAnd for those who are wondering, I don't have any of the known issues with LEDs on this set. No light bleed, no DSE and no clouding.

Reviews.Title: wow wow wow
Reviews.Author: V. Eagan "Vic Eagan"
Reviews.Content: Wow, right out of the box, very easy to set up. And when setup with the Sony BDPBX510 3D Blue Ray Player, the 3d is amazing and the way it can turn non 3d TV shows that runs through the 3d player (streaming) and DVD's are converted into a form of 3d is totally amazing. It is not as good as a movie made in 3d but it is unbelievable. I don't know why anyone would buy a non-3d system; there are not large amounts of 3d DVD's yet, but all my old DVD's look good when converted. It is sure nice that since they are both Sony products the controllers work on both items for allot of the functions. This is a 120 Hz it is so clear and vivid I can't see how the 240 Hz could be better. I am blown away so far. Sony KDL-50R550A 50-Inch 120Hz 1080p LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Big 3D TV
Reviews.Author: ScubaKathie Lawler
Reviews.Content: Got a great open box deal on this model.  Great picture and we love the passive 3D which uses the cheap polarized glasses rather than the expensive active shutter ones that give me a headache and keep turning off if you look away from the screen.  Can't wait for football season.

Reviews.Title: You cannot beat it for a couple grand!
Reviews.Author: gmcjr
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a couple months now and love it! The picture is just as great as my 42" Bravia and the sound beats it as far as i can tell. I watched the Hobbit in 3D and it was just as amazing as if I went to IMAX. The Playstation looks amazing as well along with its 3D games.My only con is that the internet part is lagging, but I don't know if that is because my modem is where it is at.  I can stream movies on my PS3 fairly well through Netflix (I only had a couple of instances where the movie was interrupted or the picture quality diminished).The TV was simple to put together and the start up was a breeze.Overall I am very pleased with my purchase thus far and I've always enjoyed watching the Bravia line of TVs.

Reviews.Title: was unsure after reading some reviews, Glad I went ahead and bought it
Reviews.Author: merle asido
Reviews.Content: Do not know what's up with some of the negative reviews. Its an amazing tv. The remote takes some time getting used to as it is not point and click like lg and Samsung touch pad remotes but the tv is fantastic. Fantastic size, Fantastic picture. I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: Sean A. Brooks
Reviews.Content: I can't stop watching this tv!  It shows a really great picture and especially for a 70". It blows everyone away when they come into the house and see it.

Reviews.Title: Superior TV
Reviews.Author: J. Pisarich
Reviews.Content: This Sony TV has excellent picture quality, and it was easy to install.  The clarity of the picture is much better than all of its competitors and the sound system is very good.  Ordering the TV from Amazon was a simple process and the TV was delivered on time.

Reviews.Title: Loving It In 3 Dimensions
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are loving this TV.  I can't speak to all of its features or even the remote, because we control everything through our Blu-ray player and with a Harmony universal remote, but the quality of the picture is outstanding.  I'm not techie enough to get into a detailed discussion of black levels and such, but the blacks on this one look great.  Also, even though we have a good amount of outside light coming into the room, the TV's brightness is such that we don't have a problem with the ambient light compromising the picture.The 3D quality is as good as any I've seen, with the possible exception of active 3D Imax.  Certainly it's as good as I would have expected or hoped for in a home setting, and as far as I'm concerned, is very comparable to the 3D we experience at theaters these days.High marks to the vendor, as well.  They were extremely responsive when I had some questions regarding the delivery logistics.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price.
Reviews.Author: mitchg
Reviews.Content: So far so good.  Picture is fine - blacks are black.  Features seem good.  Apps are slow and not real easy to use with a remote, but I didn't expect it to be PC like.  Price went up right after I bought it, so I guess I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it!
Reviews.Author: I. Suarez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item for under $2k with tax via Amazon a week ago and arrived 2 hours earlier than expected, at the time they had the best price. Delivery and condition was not an issue. It replaces my Samsung 61" DLP that we've had for almost 8 years now. I love how much features this tv has. I was specially counting on its directv features since we have genie. But as soon as I had it connected I found out the Sony remote was not capable enough to control all DTV had to offer even the simple record button was lacking so I revert back to the genie box. Picture quality is great specially when using blue ray and 3d but with DTV I thought my older DLP looked better but after a few adjustments I got it to a point I was happy with. I still have to mess with the other features such as network speed and gadget connectivity. I will update my review later.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Fred Daniel
Reviews.Content: Purchased to place in remodeled kitchen on wall. We love it and the install was easy. Even though the unit is thin, it is wider on the bottom, so we were unable to place it flat against the wall. To mount flat against the wall, we needed to use 3/4 inch spacers to keep extended bottom from touching wall. Not a big deal, but unexpected. Lots of great features like Wi-Fi and equipped to watch Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Not a plasma but pretty good picture and functionality.
Reviews.Author: whiplash1313
Reviews.Content: Great large screen tv.  Some edge washout compared to Panasonic plasma 60".  Better than projector.  Motion blur still evident but not distracting.  Great sound quality.  3-D works great.  Switches modes automatically.  Overall I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Topper
Reviews.Content: Picture is excellent, the 3D seems good but I haven't really tested it out as I'm in the process of purchasing a blueray player. The only flaw is the internet connection speed, If you're downloading movies from Netflix or Hulu, found that there's alot of pauses while the movie is playing. I actually had a spare computer and hooked that up and it seems have solved that problem so I'm guessing a laptop would help too.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Den
Reviews.Content: Was saving for large 3D TV with passive glasses as I cannot bear to use active ones for more than 30 minutes. But I bumped into this set costing a fraction of what I expected (big surprise from Sony). This TV is awesome. It's large (while the bezel is almost non-existent), the picture is good and passive 3D met all my optimistic expectations. I was afraid the interlacing in 3D mode will be visible, but sitting about 8 feet away it's really not that prominent, while 3D effect is excellent. For those curious - YES, you can use glasses from 3D movie theaters!I don't use them much, but TV has a lot of apps including most popular streaming services. Plus, there is one thing that is not documented anywhere, but works like a charm - Chromcast is embedded. So you can use your phone to send Netflix or Youtube to show on wide screen.Now to downsides. It's really just one and it didn't even convince me to take out a star. Still, worth mentioning. Netflix streaming via TV didn't work for me very well. It gets stuck after some time. Sony claims it's because of ISP, but users discovered that it only affects Netflix and only on Sony TVs. So it works fine on other devices (my PS3 handles it perfectly), and other streaming services on this TV work fine too. I hope Sony fixes this and pushes the update (update installation is a breeze BTW).UPDATE: 3/27/2014 - Sony just pushed the update which fixes the issues with Netflix. Just watched Turbo in 3D directly on TV without any interruptions whatsoever! Now I'm happy.

Reviews.Title: What I expected, Glad I bought it
Reviews.Author: South Florida Trial Lawyer
Reviews.Content: The only hesitation I had about this TV was that it is not 4k.  I wanted something that would be connected to the internet and I am prejudiced toward Sony products.  There was a delay of two days getting the TV from prime and Amazon compensated me $70 for the delay which I was satisfied with (there was a blizzard where the TV was originating from).  The TV delivery guys arrived when they said they would and set it up within minutes.  I am not technical but it took only minutes to get it set up with my wifi and log into my Amazon Prime account.  Now I watch movies easily from Prime (although Netflix, Hulu, etc would be just as easy) and get back to my DirectTV just as easily.  I bought a BluRay 3D player and love watching 3D movies on it.  I get nothing but compliments on the TV.  At around $2k this wasn't cheap but I felt it was worth the money.  I am sure once 4k drops in price in a year or two this will make the voyage to my bedroom and I will get a 4k to replace this in the famly room.  It is the quality I would expect from a Sony product.

Reviews.Title: outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph Castro
Reviews.Content: Outstanding picture, easy set up and delivered on time. No complaints about the TV, did not wall mount it as it looked good on the stand and fit the space well.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV with a fantastic price and a dumb description.
Reviews.Author: David L. Gibbons
Reviews.Content: I was concerned that they described this TV as "receiver-less" but I finally found out what they meant and ordered one.  Direct TV customers must purchase a main Direct TV receiver and for any TV not near the main receiver they must purchase a small receiver that accesses the main receiver elsewhere in the house.  This TV has that small receiver built-in so no small Direct TV receiver is needed when this TV is used away from the main one.  Therefore I don't think of this TV as receiver-less, but as having an extra receiver.  If you don't have Direct TV it's like any other TV and hooks up like any other TV.  You won't find an explanation at Sony.com but you will at the Direct TV website.  Oh well.  Let them call it what they will, it's a fantastic TV at a fantastic price.  We have had it in service for two months and enjoyed it.  The 3-D is great and we have had fun with 3-D when guests come.  I highly recommend it.  Oh, the 3-D glasses arrive in two parts and you assemble the lenses to the earpieces.  Twice we have had a pair separate the lenses from the earpieces.  I really do need to get the super glue out and fix that.

Reviews.Title: Surprised how good the picture is
Reviews.Author: Michael Horn "mikie"
Reviews.Content: I've purchased this set thru the Army Post Exchange Service in South Korea and am just blown away with the picture quality. Passive 3D works well - no headaches, dizziness or other maladies while watching DVDs. Color, Brightness, Contrast and Hue need to be adjusted to taste - and once settled - the quality and accuracy of the picture is as good as anything I've seen.This set runs dual voltage (either 220v Korean, or 110v through a transformer). Set up in less than 20 minutes to my NeatGear dual band Wi-Fi and a Web based VPN that allows me access to world wide content.It hooked up easily to Korean Cable, ROKU3, and streams movies easily from Amazon Prime.TV sound quality is not bad - but adding a Boise sound system completed the total entertainment package. No problems with the hookup here either.Plenty of HDMI ports for my 3D DVD player - and a PS4 has just been added and the action, motion capture and overall image quality adds a new dimension to computer gaming.I'm a believer.

Reviews.Title: best Price & Good TV
Reviews.Author: man-gyu lee
Reviews.Content: Really had a good chance to buy a good product.Purchase Promotion was unaware of the existence of the DVD Player,I again ask, can give thanks after checking the appropriate response.Amazon.com is also best to purchase electronic products.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv absolutely stunning picture
Reviews.Author: Harry A. Smith
Reviews.Content: Right out if the box this thing is beautiful. You do have to make some subtle picture changes to your liking. One big adjustment, you have to turn off the motionflow completely. It seems like the frame rate stutters the picture because of it, it basically makes your movies look like they were shot on super clear video tape, some call it the "soap opera" look. It just looks fake to me. 3d is very cool with video games or movies, nice extra that I really wasn't planning on using too much, nice extra to have though. As some people have said the internet with the tv is a bit slow and sometimes freezes here and there while loading. This is something I am not worried about as I won't be using it much. I would advise a sound system with this. Sound bars are a great cheap upgrade, I was able to velcro my soundbar right under the tv, looks like it was made for it. I don't mean to sound negative, these are some little things I noticed. Again I absolutely love this thing, colors are so clear and the picture is top notch with a few adjustments. Blacks seem great, maybe a bit dark for my taste but just looks stunning. So what are you waiting for....go buy this one......now!!!Update- just a small update. I have noticed on bright white screens like olympic skiing or hockey that there are some lines and "clouds" on the screen, almost looks like the screen is dirty. They are like a light gray ghost almost. I am very picky about my picture and just wanted to let people know. I will probably let it go as I have seen other people post about this issue and get replacement sets that are worse. Not sure if this is typical or not but I do really like the set and don't think I want to chance something worse or another brand with another set with other problems.

Reviews.Title: Replaced Samsung LCD
Reviews.Author: RJW "RJW"
Reviews.Content: Personal preference but the picture is just cleaner and motion smoother on the Sony. Colors seem more lifelike and bright. Have this same one in 46" for bedroom and kids like the netflix app so good excuse for dad's football games (wife didn't buy into that but best I could do). Don't like the stand and with wall mount really hard to access ports is only complaint.

Reviews.Title: Had if for a month and love it so far
Reviews.Author: gato
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace a crappy Toshiba 65' DLP that started getting the white-dot problem shortly after replacing it's bulb for $150. Love this TV, comes with smart TV capabilities (though kind of slow) and the image is crystal clear once you do some basic calibration using any of the calibration DVDs. Literally last night was watching Despicable Me 2 and asked my friend that was watching with me if the screen suddenly turned too vivid and they said nope, the picture has been this great the whole movie!

Reviews.Title: Great Media Room TV for Our Family
Reviews.Author: LeAnn "sillyleann"
Reviews.Content: I am a Stay at Home Mom not a TV tech enthusiast.  So, although I consider myself a tech nerd, I really am not.  I am good at reading, researching, and picking from what seems to be the best for my family.  So, please read with this in mind.  This is our 3rd Sony and 3rd "flat screen".  We have been brand loyal since the very first 32 inch Sony Bravia that wowed two financially struggling grad school newly weds.  After having such amazing luck with our next 46 inch Sony Bravia, we didn't hesitate looking to Sony for our new Media room.What we love:The quality of OTA TV is simply stunning.  Blu-Ray and DVD's look amazing on this.  3D is awesome and lots of fun for our family.  As we have 3 young kids, the passive 3D is so much easier for us.  We don't have to worry about expensive glasses, recharging, etc.  My son wears glasses and has a hard time with active glasses.  We have had a room full of little boys watching a 3D movie.  I don't mind at all handing out glasses to them.  We also really like how it natively supports Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon.Some minor grips:It takes a long time to get the "Internet" sources once the TV is powered on.  It can take up to 60 seconds.  We have it plugged directly in to the network via ethernet.  So, I am not sure why there needs to be such a lag.I get lost in the menus.  We have had it since July 5, 2013.  I would think I would have gotten used to the menus.  I'm not sure what it is.  Maybe they are not very intuitive.The menus and options have a tiny bit of lag.  It isn't instant like I am used to on my other Sony's.  Once I depress a button, it can take two or three seconds to respond.  I have gotten used to it, but it is still a pain.One thing to note:We have experienced the issue of the screen going black when switching from various inputs.  I have always pushed the screen off/on button to turn it back on.  I am going to contact Sony about it.  It is annoying.  Another reviewer posted a solution they got from Customer Service.  I have not tried it nor have I contacted Sony yet.Bottom Line:It is perfect for our Media Room where it is watched by a family of 5 that includes 3 small children.  It is easy for my 9 and 7 year old to operate.  I am sure there are "better" TV's out there.  The price, features, and size make this TV a home run in our house.

Reviews.Title: This TV has been fantastic.  The picture is extremely clear, crisp, and has vibrant colors.
Reviews.Author: Greg Seppelt
Reviews.Content: This TV has been fantastic.  The picture is extremely clear, crisp, and has vibrant colors.  The thin design and profile of the TV is also great, I love the 1/2" frame around the TV as opposed to thick borders on cheaper TVs.The Smart features are very useful, although surfing the internet can be a little cumbersome.I also love that this TV has 2 USB ports where you can plug in extrnal hard drives loaded with media and play it direct through the TV.  I currently have 4TB of storage loaded with movies, tv shows, music, and pictures connected to my TV and ready to watch at a moments notice.The TV also has 3D capabilites, and although I dont use the 3D very often I find that it looks great on this TV and the picture really comes alive.

Reviews.Title: Nearly perfect!!
Reviews.Author: semi-retired "Bob"
Reviews.Content: Decided on this model due to reviews and in store experience with picture, and it has pic in pic.  It doesn't seem to allow my satellite remote to turn it on and off or to control volume, the itsy, bitsy green on light is nearly invisible from across the room.Other than that, this one is nearly perfect.  I haven't tried the smart TV functions since we live in an area without an easy, cheap Wi-Fi solution.  Sound is amazing in a large room without added speaker help.  Would recommend and wouldbuy again.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Gary Farnon
Reviews.Content: There is some ghosting issues....but not a hindrance at all!  I was going to buy the Samsung 7500, but could not justifying paying an extra $700 for the same features!  Thanks Amazon and Sony!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful  brilliant color TV
Reviews.Author: Sullyman
Reviews.Content: This is a  really nice TV . I've been buying Sony  TV's for year and there is a reason why QUALITY  This smart tv is very nicely made. I have had this TV for about a month and haven't experienced any of the screen artifact color problems and spotting that some of the bad reviews have mentioned.If you are ordering this or any other LED tv and  you live in a cold climate  be sure not to turn the TV on until it has warmed up and reached Room temperature ,if not you could damage the television.After mine was acclimated to the room temp the first thing I did was recalibrate  the picture settings. There are several Blu-ray Discs on the market made for just this purpose,well worth the money and a little extra time. The one I used was Disney's Wow HD Home Theater disc. It's very easy to use  and it walks you through the different adjustments for a truly incredible tv picture. The black colors are better than most LED TV's I've seen. Getting blacker blacks is a problem for LED televisions but the technology has improved greatly.The only thing that stopped me from giving a full 5 stars was that the remote should have back lighting. There are far too many buttons for it not to have back lighting. Instead I use the Logitech Harmony Ultimate remote. Look in to them they will change the way you control your audio and video equipment.On the whole this Sony TV is one of the best I've seen and the solid chassis construction seems so much nicer than most of the other sets I've looked at. To me Sony's quality has always been worth paying a little extra for.One more note after 2 months of ownership:If you like 3D this is the one for you! The passive 3D is truly stunning. The passive 3D glasses are so easy on the eyes compared the active 3D glasses used in other 3D models. You'll hardly know you have the glasses on even over eye glasses.I just can't say enough good things about Sony and this TV.

Reviews.Title: Ed the TV man
Reviews.Author: edward d murphy
Reviews.Content: The 50" KDL-50R 550A is an outstanding TV.  Only drawback is the built in speaker system built into the back of the TV.  Not recommended to be put inside a wall cabinet...which is what we have.  We ended up purchasing a Sony sound bar with wireless woofer. Very easy to hook up the sound system.  That solved the sound problem immediately I am happy to report.  I personally think Sony makes the best  TV remote of any  brand TV out there.  This is very important to me as others make remotes are so small and somewhat difficult to read the buttons! Sony customer support  was excellent...even though talking to someone in the Philippines was a challenge.Ed, The TV Man

Reviews.Title: Four minutes to connect to wireless
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth Genly
Reviews.Content: I'm not a TV enthusiast;I don't follow what the latest specs are.  I am a cord cutter.  I bought this TV because it was internet capable.  To my great disappointment it takes four minutes for the TV to connect via the wireless connection.  It takes 40 seconds through the wired ethernet connection.  I'm quite amazed Sony could release this TV with such a bad connect time.  I called Sony support.  They asked me a bunch of questions and then said "this is normal operation". Ugggh. Really Sony?  This is worse than waiting for a vacuum tube TV to be ready.The user interface is a little slow.  Seems to be an underpowered processor running the TV.  But I find it acceptable.  I have no idea how this compares to other TVs.The Sony TV itself is chromecast capable.  So, four minutes after turning on the TV, I can initiate play of netflix and youtube programming from my Android phone.  I didn't expect that.  Very nice feature.  This TV has a lot of features.  Although the TV supports Hulu Plus, it doesn't have the chromecast feature.To work around the slow connect time I bought a Chromecast and plugged it in to one of the TV's HDMI inputs.  Chromecast is always connected.  No delay after turning on the TV.  It strikes me as silly every time I see both the Chromecast and the TV in my phone's youtube/netflix apps connect menu.  Chromecast does support hulu plus.  Interestingly the Chromecast will not play netflix 3D content in 3D, but the TV will.  I also noticed Chromecast will not play Amazon Instant Video content.  For that I have to go back to the TV.I sincerely hope the connect time issue will be corrected with a future software update.Chris G.

Reviews.Title: 70 inches of pure bliss
Reviews.Author: Samara McDonald
Reviews.Content: My first Sony TV hasn't disappointed me yet.  4 HDMI ports on the back, built in wireless along with Netflix, Sony Entertainment Network, Amazon Prime.  Only thing that has been spotty with the wireless was when I attempted to use it with my DirectTV receiver and moved the Genie main box too far away.This TV intergrates seemlessly with my PS3 and Sony STR-DA2800ES 7.2 Channel 4K AV Receiver with Automation.Color is crisp and sharp.  My wife does complain that the HD is too perfect and now her shows feel like they are acting out in front of her (and she feels this makes it seem like cheap camera work).My only complaint has been more from my specific set up - I have the TV wall mounted above my fire place and due to the height and angles, I catch reflections of the light on the ceiling fan.  I solved this problem by purchasing 2 lamps and placing them in the room, so I no longer get the light reflections.

Reviews.Title: Best I've seen
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey M Pilling
Reviews.Content: Hands down this tv has the best picture quality out there. The 3d looks great. The colors are great. Can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture!
Reviews.Author: R. B. Stine
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. I did a tremendous amount of research for weeks before finally buckling down on this one. This was to be my first large screen TV purchase as the largest I had in my home was 40". I was torn between this one and: Samsung PN60F8500 60 Inch 1080p PlasmaI opted for this one because at this time it was cheaper being a non-plasma TV and of course for the extra size. I'll probably snatch up that Samsung Plasma when it comes down in price down the road as it's rated as one of the best Plasma's for 2013.The picture is amazing and I've yet to even use the 3D because I don't own any 3D movies yet, but I'm really looking forward to it as everyone raved how great it is in reviews. Anything I watch in HD looks eerily life like almost like people are actually in my living room. That took me some getting used to. I guess if you aren't use to high end HD programming on a "real" TV that's designed to support it, you'll see what I mean.Remote is fine, nothing mind blowing.Sound is fine, nothing mind blowing. I use a home theater system anyways for sound.Overall look is very sleek and appealing. The stand is very stylish (and sturdy) compared to other TV's - easy to assemble the stand, but you'll definitely need a buddy to help you lift the screen onto the stand (I'm a big guy and figured I could handle it, but you'll want help so you don't drop this beaut or break your back).The built-in Wi-Fi is high quality. It picks up my Wi-Fi signal from across the house and hasn't skipped a beat anytime I watch Netflix.I haven't even played around with all the options and apps yet that are built-in because I've been waiting on a few more things in the mail before I can finally feel like it's settled in and I can get down to it, but I'm sure they're superb like all the reviews I read before I bought it mentioned.It has plenty of connections for all of your devices.If you have the money to throw at it and finally want a large screen in your house, this is the one (or the above Samsung one). My only complaint would be that it doesn't swivel, but that would be more of a "nice to have" then actual need for me.

Reviews.Title: Best gaming HDTV at 70 inches
Reviews.Author: Brae L. Hulery "Braehole"
Reviews.Content: Not sure how many twitch gamers are looking at this TV but input lag time matters for FPS and online fighting games. This TV is the lowest (so far)for 70 inch HDTV in the great category at 36ms. Bad input lag means you or your kid will get shot before he sees it on the screen. Not fun for gaming if you have bad input lag, so if you or your kids play lots of games online check out these two sites to find a TV for both movies and gaming.With the new consoles coming towards the end of the year, marketing low input lag TVs and their gaming advantages could be a smart opportunity for a savvy TV manufacturer. I wonder if any manufacturer company guys look at these comments....[...][...]

Reviews.Title: Love everything except the price.
Reviews.Author: Turner "turner"
Reviews.Content: Got this tv maybe 6 months ago and I dig it.  I don't use the internet it comes with (use the xbox for that), but dig the size and pretty much everything about it except the price.  Movies made in 3-d are very cool, the simulated 3-d is not as good, but can be interesting.  I find that the 3-d simulated works about the best with Minecraft.  We got the sony audio receiver and sony blu ray player (and tv guardian) and the three sony devices work really well together.  I was a little concerned about getting everything to work but it was really a breeze.  I like how when I turn on the blu ray, the tv and audio receiver automatically comes on.  And they turn off when I turn off the blu ray player.  The sony audio receiver seems to sometimes even automatically receive the xbox even though it is coming in on a different hdmi cable.  The remotes can control each other also to some degree.  Wall mounted the tv.  The 3-d with sony uses the same glasses as those in the theaters, not the battery powered ones that other 3-d tv's are using.  I think there was one other tv brand that also used the theater type glasses.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Jagdish "nova3351"
Reviews.Content: design is great, light weight, good in low and bright light situations. did not have any issues in the last 7 months.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but pricey and lack some features
Reviews.Author: Timothy T.
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great picture.Works well with my Sony receiver and blue-ray player.  No typing in codes or other configuration.  It just all works together.  Turning on one device automatically turns on all three in the appropriate configuration.  For example, when watching over-the-air channels going straight to the TV, I just press one button to turn on the TV and the receiver automatically turns on and pumps the audio to the surround sound speakers.  Very convenient.Good integration with Netflix.  There is a dedicated Netflix button on the remote.Pairs with iPad for Youtube.  The iPad can be used to control which Youtube videos to show.  That way, I can lay back on my couch while browsing Youtube content.Supports 3D and comes with 3D glasses.Cons:Pricey.  It's not cheap compared to other brands.  In fact, close to 100% more expensive, even compared to decent brands like Samsung and Visio.Limited set of hard to upgrade apps.  Fortunately, the most popular apps are bundled, including Youtube, Netflix, and Hulu.DLNA is slow and buggy.  Streaming from my PC over wifi (20' away in the same room with a new top-of-the-line Asus wireless router) usually works but sometimes hangs due to buffering.  Some video file formats are not supported (e.g., .m2ts files from my Sony camcorder).  And, browsing directories with large files or a large number of files of folders takes a long time (sometimes minutes).3D streaming on Netflix often hangs for buffering.  This might be related to the hanging problem I see for DLNA.  This might be a wifi problem.  Even my new Sony Pro 13 laptop has below average wifi performance and required a driver update to get just acceptable wifi.Screen mirroring only works with limited clients.  It doesn't work with Sony VAIO laptops (even my Pro 13 that I just bought last Christmas and which has Windows 8.1 support for Miracast).  I communicated with Sony support, and they indicated that only Sony Xperia phones are supported.  Fortunately, I discovered that my HTC One M7 phone (with KitKat) does work for screen mirroring, and furthermore, both video and audio work.

Reviews.Title: I like SONY products
Reviews.Author: Wrgrace88888
Reviews.Content: I like SONY products, and enjoying the picture quality.Amazon arranged very good delivering service, and they set the TV for me. They also took back the package box, it is good for me, because the big and heavy box is a waste, you will never use again, even you are moving your home.Thanks!
