Reviews.Title: Could've been great if it weren't for the defects
Reviews.Author: Adriane D Williams
Reviews.Content: Before I get into the defects I experienced with the TV I received, I'll start with the good and bad qualities.Positives- The most notable positive of this TV is the 3D quality. There are two (real) IMAX theaters near my home (Minnesota Zoo and Paragon 15) and I have to say that the 3D quality of this TV trumps even those theaters.- The picture quality is phenomenal for the price.- The input lag is very low (31ms) and Motionflow makes everything very smooth, so this is a great TV for gaming.- Can get extremely bright.Negatives- Red error is really bad especially with skin tones.- Not enough adjustability for the picture compared to other TVs.- I only got Miracast to work once.Now for the story of why I don't own this TV anymore:I got my TV (60R550A) and found that there were three large white blobs in the middle of the panel and one small one toward the upper left. I contacted SONY and was told that they'd send me an exact replacement. Well, the rep that I spoke to must've been confused or just didn't want to call me back to tell me that they didn't have any more new 60R550A sets available. What I received was a 70R520A. I immediately refused the delivery thinking it was a mistake and called SONY. After speaking with 3 different reps in two different departments for almost an hour, I found out that they intentionally sent me the 70R520A without notifying me. I told them that it was unacceptable to send me a TV that didn't match the specs of the TV I was getting replaced (the 520A is a non-3D version of the R550A) even if it was a bigger TV. They agreed and offered to replace my defective set with a 60W850B. I got it today, and though it has active 3D instead of passive 3D like the R550A, it's a much better TV overall.

Reviews.Title: 70" sony 3d tv
Reviews.Author: Kent Weiderman
Reviews.Content: good picture, haven't tired 3d yet, color will need to be readjusted to your liking. takes some time to fine tune, check reviews to get some of other users adjustments to get settings, so far working great.

Reviews.Title: Dark Screen?
Reviews.Author: bizzyziggy
Reviews.Content: Since you are limited in characters on the questions, I have to ask it here.  I have had this for over a week and the screen seems dark.  I tried the calibration settings posted by others and the old Optimizer Disc.  Everything else is great, color, clarity, etc..., but the image just appears dark to me.  I ordered the WOW Disc, used it, and still no luck.  I am using the PS3 as my player.  I purchased a new HDMI cable so I am not sure if it is just me?  I previously had a Sony 40-inch which was great and I never had this problem.  I know there are different variables such as the PS3 settings.  Could it just be adjusting to a 70-inch screen?s  Especially since I was really careful with the Brightness and Contrast settings when calibrating.  Now I did notice when watching a movie that the entire screen did go a level darker while watching during a scene.  No cloudiness issues though.  Wondering if I should send it back while I can?

Reviews.Title: Great quality, doesn't look pixelated like many large TVs
Reviews.Author: D. Gaston
Reviews.Content: I've had this since December (bought it during Black Friday sale), and it's great.  I usually buy Sony TVs because I prefer their quality and clarity over other brands.  I looked at Samsung as well but I liked the Sony better when comparing side by side at a local store.  The 3D is really just a gimmick, it's not anything to write home about, but the regular 2D is awesome.  People freak out when they come over and see my huge TV, and how clear the picture is.  I didn't mess with any settings, I just plugged it in and only watch HD programming.  I've played Xbox on it too and that's awesome.  Anyway, after two months of use, I'm very happy with it.  Delivery through Amazon was great too, it was brought to me in a freight truck and the guys who delivered it were extremely careful with the box.  I didn't have them unpack it or anything, but they were willing to.  I am the type of person who only makes big purchases like this in-person, so ordering a 70" TV online was really nerve-racking for me, but I would do it again in a heartbeat after this experience.

Reviews.Title: Best picture I've seen
Reviews.Author: farticular "Hev"
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I purchased this after over a year of debating..It's terrific.  This is the best picture I've seen on any set, and I know this isn't an xbr...excluding 4k.  I've been holding out on buying a new tv because I've hated the look of all the new TV's I've seen at friends houses, stores, etc. I have a Sony Grand Wega(2004 1080i) which I've preferred to the new tv's.. It must be the settings but most of all, it's the smoothing(soap opera), from what i"ve come to learn, is what I've been hating.  Also, everyone I know has a Samsung and says they're supposed to have the best picture because that's what everyone is told.  I don't think any of this Samsung talk actually comes from people's eyeballs, just what everyone seems to think.  Not to go off on a rant but Sony always has the best picture to these eyeballs.  I took some of the setting suggestions from reviews on Amazon, and they're great.  I've even turned on motionflow for a couple shows like Game of Thrones, and it actually still looks pretty great.  The motionflow doesn't seem to be as bad as I've seen on other Tv's where actors' motion looks too lifelike.  I bought it from Amazon...shipped by fedex, and it came in great condition.

Reviews.Title: Great TV and Great Value
Reviews.Author: Luis Colmenares
Reviews.Content: Great product from Sony. Great Tv. Plenty of connections for different devices. Great picture quality and great tv speakers. Also, wanted to add that the 3D is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: It's a Sony - update
Reviews.Author: Richard S. Terranova
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, easy set-up, Great Apps, 3D is excellent. It's a Sony, the one and only. Nothing more that I can say.Update-2/2/14 - The TV has a green strip from the top of the TV to the bottom about 12" wide on the right hand side of the TV. I called customer service and was told to reset the TV. After resetting, the strip went away but reappeared about 2 hours later. I will call customer service again tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: Happy with TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: You are going to receive the non-tech version on this review.  The setup was easy, the quality is good and we are happy with our choice.

Reviews.Title: Too reflective, great picture, smart apps dodgy
Reviews.Author: deir
Reviews.Content: I knew that this was too reflective when I bought it, but I held on to it because the picture, as with every Sony I've gotten, is so good. Seeing us in the reflection of the tv drives me up the wall, and I see it even when I turn off ambient lighting (which I'd like to have the option to leave on, if I want to - don't want to be a slave to my TV). Also, our family is pretty good with tech gadgets but can't get the smart tv apps working consistently, no matter what we do. 3-D Looks great. 4 pairs of glasses standard is super. Just wish I'd waited for this reflective screen (yes, yes, deeper black color...) phase to end before I'd gotten another big tv.

Reviews.Title: top notch product
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: exceeds all expectations.after living with it for a few weeks it was the perfect choice for daily viewing, day or nite

Reviews.Title: sony 60"tv
Reviews.Author: michael mozzillo
Reviews.Content: Everything is as I expected. The picture quality is perfect and it looks great on the wall. My only complaint is it takes too long to change channels. The new channel comes on for an instant then goes black for a few seconds before it comes back. That's a lifetime when switching from game to game.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: IanT "IanT"
Reviews.Content: I already own an XBR950 55" and love it. My only concern it that to watch 3D I have to wear the active 3D glasses which are fairly heavy and places a strain on your head. I really wanted to buy the 4K - however, I was not prepared to spend $5,000.00 to buy a TV. Amazon sent me their Black Friday special and there was this beauty. On reading that it had passive 3D and the I could use similar glasses like those in the theaters I asked my wife's permission to spend a little over $2,100.00 and when she saw what it was for readily agreed. Now, everyone watches movies in the family room. Love the BIG screen, not glare (it is near my sliding glass door which is normally left with the screen open).  Picture quality is well - Sony quality. 3D is just amazing. Full effects like in the theater.  If you have surround sound and a good sub-woofer then you will enjoy it.  Mine is connected via a Sony STRDH830 Sony 3D 7.1 Channel A/V Receiver.  I also have a Polk Audio CS20 Center Channel Speaker  and a Polk Audio PSW505 12-Inch Powered Subwoofer in my surround sound system.  My investment was worth every penny. Will highly recommend this to everyone.  Has 4HDMI ports plus picture screen adjustment  and lots of other features that I am not going to invest time to speak about. Try it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Sreenivasan
Reviews.Content: Great Product from the reputed Company SONY. Easy installation, and connects to Wifi in seconds. This is my 2nd LED TV from SONY. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Decent Passive 3-D TV
Reviews.Author: Ali Moosvi
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV from Amazon last week and after playing around with the settings figured how to create 3 different profiles, one each for Vivid, Standard and Custom (press Options on your remote and select the profile you want to configure).  In all the 3 profiles the first three changes you want to do is  "Reset" to factory defaults,  then turn off the Light Sensor under Settings->Eco and Motionflow. This will be your baseline for each of the 3 Profiles. You can then adjust the other settings to your taste and if you mess repeat steps  for the baseline and then try again.I was going to return this TV after 3 days till I figured out the above tuning process.  This is the only 3-D passive TV in the 70" screen size. I played 3-D Avatar and Hobbit and it was awesome. Picture quality and 3-D effects were outstanding using my Sony BDP-S790. The simulated 3-D feature looks pretty good for  watching HD TV broadcasts for wild life and outdoor landscape.The browser and YouTube interface is terrible  and Network configuration is a bit painful. Even though my laptop, ipad, AppleTV quickly find my router and connect, the Sony wireless device takes a while to find my router and eventually fails.  Have to try several times to get connected.  Since I use AppleTV for watching YouTube and my laptop for browser the network configuration issue don't affect me much.  There is Sony Entertainment package which I believe is decent that you can use if you can get a stable network connectivity. I would have given it a 5-Star if the network configuration was easy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Dr. Dave "Dr. Dave"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic television, and the 3-D feature, while not in great use around our home, is still near-theatre quality.No downside to the function or viewing, as long as it is in true 1080. Otherwise, watching non-HD content gets choppy looking, as the processor seems to have a hard time filling-in the frames properly.Deepest blacks I've seen on a non-plasma.Con: Sound...not bright, not loud.  A sound bar is nearly mandatory for a room larger than a small bedroom.Overall, thrilled with purchase!

Reviews.Title: Sony Performs
Reviews.Author: James Mur
Reviews.Content: This Sony performs way beyond the price paid!  Picture is excellent and the 3-D feature is superior to any expectations we had when it was "just another feature" of the set in our minds when we made the purchasing decision. Wi-fi signal is strong and set up was a snap. Sound is just average, which is the case with most thin profile sets.  Would not hesitate to recommend the Sony KDL-60R550A to anyone considering a LED television.

Reviews.Title: Great Video Processing and Picture, takes internet to TV to a new level.
Reviews.Author: erick alan
Reviews.Content: Great picture, especially the processing of internet TV along with the Noise Reduction and "Motion Flow" features enabled. I use all of the noise reduction and motion flow settings on low and recently turned off "LED motion"", what ever that is. The screen may seem blotchy when there is not signal and the TV is displaying black, but that is an artifact of the TV/Input not the Panel. Different devices and Apps do not exhibit this blotchy black screen. So don't panic fi you think you have a defective panel. It is just noise or something; and is not present in actual use or the panel.The Sony blu ray I also bought can be controlled by the TV remote.The TV does not have issues with Sony servers as some elude. It is Linux/Opera based and has to boot when powered on, so the Smart TV functions are not available for a minute or so.I am use to using a computer for internet TV so I find the APPs cumbersome and Netflix will crash if you give it too many commands. You get use to the need to slow down and give the TV a chance to perform the action commanded.The picture quality rivals my 27"IPS LG monitor. They are a little different though; having not tried to match the settings.I cannot stress enough how much better Netflix and Amazon are processed and displayed compared to a Browser environment.The internet browser on the the Sony Blows and is fairly useless to me. I use one of the HDMI inputs connected to my computer if there is a website I wish to view on my TV. Again the noise reduction improves the picture compared to my monitor/video card.The remote is small, but after three weeks I am fairly use to it.I bought this TV at a local retailer. Their website stated a price of $899, but when I got to the store it was $699 the week before labor day. Now they sell it for $1200.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Xiaosen Xie "The Black Swan"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at a Sony store since it went on sale (price was only slightly higher than the current price on amazon). I did quite a bit of research on similarly priced and sized TVs (Panasonic, Sharp, Samsung, LG, Vizio) and this is basically the best one out of the bunch (IMHO) due to price, quality and features. Worked well out of the box with PS3 attached.Passive 3D was pretty impressive (btw, these TV use passive 3D IPS panels manufactured by LG; the same guys that make screens for Apple products i.e. iphones, imacs, etc.). The TV came with 4 pairs of glasses. Color was great even with manufacturer settings as some of the other reviewers have stated. The black color is comparable to those on a plasma TV.Thought Sony was down for the count when it came to TVs, but they managed to exceed expectations on this one. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Surprise pro tv  installation...very happy
Reviews.Author: Drew J Loucks
Reviews.Content: The delivery staff called me to arrange a convenient delivery time.  I expected at most a little help getting ninety pounds of technology into the house.  But, no...they carried in into my living room, unpackaged it, installed the base (many metric screws), connected all the cables and verified Sony's quality is still the best.  This TV is smart. It simulates 3D, talked to my phone, and internet.  Yes, I am a happy camper.DL

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: amit patel
Reviews.Content: I love the TV its a perfect addition to my living room, and the fact that the seller delivered the next day even though the estimate was a week out made it even better. Will definitely come back to this seller again.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with the delivery and set up by Amazon
Reviews.Author: Phil W. Young "Baypro"
Reviews.Content: I bought the 70" 3D Internet model, as I have a huge wall to fill, and the price was great. Amazon did a great job of delivering and setting up the TV. The two delivery guys were very courteous and took the box and packing materials with them. There is some fade when viewing the screen from the side. Is there a way to correct this in the set up or is this something that LCD's do?There's another issue that I can't figure out. This TV was to come with one free year of Netflix. The instructions say to hit the "SEN" button on the remote control and "navigate to the Promotional Offer App., then to input your email address then check your email to receive your referral code". The only thing is that there is NO Promotional Offer App available. I have tried numerous times but it's just not there. Has anyone out there had the same problem in setting up the Netflix offer? There's also a free year offer for Hulu Plus and a one month free offer for Music Unlimited, which I haven't tried to set up yet. I'll add additional reviews after I have had the TV longer.UPDATE:OK, It's now October 17 and we've had the TV for over a month. The problem with the Netflix not working is all ironed out after I called the company. It seems that I wasn't looking far enough down on the set-up site. The television is remarkable and I now have both the free Netflix 1 year trial and also Amazon Prime movies set up on the TV. I also order 3D movies from Amazon (much better prices than the big box stores) and have 12 pairs of 3-D glasses. By the way, there are four Sony 3D glasses that were included with the set (a surprise that I didn't expect!)and I ordered an additional 4 adult glasses (Vizio models) and 4 kids size glasses. The 3D on the set is amazing and every bit as sharp and clear as our old 40" Sony I now have in the bedroom, that used the old 3D glasses that needed batteries.

Reviews.Title: Sony TV
Reviews.Author: Dawn Sylke
Reviews.Content: Love the picture. Love the fact that you can get internet on this tv. This tv was worth the extra week wait.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL70R550A Review
Reviews.Author: VR
Reviews.Content: Love the TV and it got here in perfect shape. Beautiful picture and 3D too. And wireless is great feature.

Reviews.Title: Sony drops the ball
Reviews.Author: ron
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a TV with a great picture, reasonably fast menu response and a great DirecTV RVU experience, look elsewhere. I purchased this TV because I own many other Sony products and have had a great experience in the past. I am on my second TV. When I received my first delivery I was very excited. I was going up to a 60” over a 50” and this model was a bit thinner than my Panasonic plasma. The interface of this model is very slow, painfully slow. There are other brands that make this “Smart TV” seem like its from 2009. I bought the tv specifically because of its ability to connect with the Genie from DirecTV, which it does. It only takes 1:30min to start up… The interface is much, much slower than the clients that connect to my other sets off of the Genie. I will end up moving the Genie to this location which entirely defeats the purpose of the TV. This however I guess I could live with if it wasn’t for the vastly inconsistent backlighting and shadowing that occurs within the picture. You won’t notice it until the first time that you sit down at night to watch a movie. As soon as the screen has a somewhat uniform color too it such as a sky scene or a shot of a yard, your eyes will immediately tract to the very distracting inconsistencies. I am on my second set sent from Sony to try to remedy this issue but the “new” (I think it’s refurbished) set is worse than the first. I am going to make a third call in to Sony tomorrow 3-32-2014 to see if anything can be done but I do not have much faith. I am now 6 weeks in and fear that I will be stuck with this 1500 dollar disappointment. If you are considering a new flat screen I would urge you to look elsewhere as Sony doesn’t seem to have this area of their electronics perfected.

Reviews.Title: Great TV & Vaule
Reviews.Author: Thomas Tyler
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to finally decide on this TV. I needed a 60" and was thinking about buying a Panasonic plasma, but decided to go for the LED. Very glad I did. I have had bad experience in the past with Samsung TVs, which I also looked at, and have always liked Sonys.PROS:Picture Quality:Overall picture quality is great. It has great black ranges for not being a plasma, but still provides all of the pros of a LED TV.1080p Quality:All of my devices use 1080p quality, so 720p is not something I would see. From the quick settings changes that I made, 720p looked good, but as always, 1080p is much better. There is no comparison of 1080p to any Plasma, at least in my room.3D:The TV uses passive 3D, which doesn't require powered glasses. Very nice as you don't have to wear heavy glasses that cause your eyes to strain. Having said that, I can count on one hand how many times I have used 3D. Maybe it just isn't for me, and maybe someday it will get more use, but at this time, it is more like an extra feature than a necessity. I will say, if you are looking for a 3D TV, passive glasses are the way to go, and the picture quality is amazing, even streaming from Netflix! The size of the screen goes a long way to bringing that theater experience home.CONS:There aren't a lot. Sony really needs to work on their menu response time, but I hardly ever use the menu's anyway. Also, I was a little disappointed in the size of the bezel around the edge, and still find myself a little jealous when I see a tiny bezel on a Samsung. However, that is not enough of an issue to make me want a different TV.

Reviews.Title: Great definition and great price for 70 TV
Reviews.Author: Darin Grey
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased for my dad who wanted the big screen and 3d experience.  The TV has passive glasses (comes with 4) which means you dont have to have batteries in them and the tv does all the 3d encoding.  Even regular tv programs look 3d when you turn on the simulated 3d.  Not as good as a movie made for 3d, but the simulator does a good job.  The TV is heavy though so make sure to have a good quality bracket that is professionally installed.  The factory sound on the tv is decent as well.  We're hooking it up to a 5.1 system so we wont be using the factory sound too long.  The tv looks nice, HD is super sharp... no complaints.  I think the 3d glasses from the movies work with it as well so if you have kids, keep the next pair of movie 3d glasses.

Reviews.Title: Sony 50" TV - well worth the cost!
Reviews.Author: T. G. "Timster"
Reviews.Content: Low price on one of the best values out there on a 50" LCD 3D TV!  Color and brightness are excellent and if you don't like the factory settings there are plenty of controls/settings.  Search the internet for many of the options (if needed).

Reviews.Title: A big Sony for less than a thousand...heck yes.
Reviews.Author: dbrain78
Reviews.Content: I have actually purchased this tv twice.  The first time I started it up there was something weird about the backlight.  There were light patches all over the screen.  When watching a movie at night the light patches almost bleached out the dark scenes.  I did some research and found out this happens on a lot of sets.  There were several suggestions (turn down the backlight, try wiping the screen with a soft cloth, turn off eco settings.)  None of these actually got rid of it.  I took a picture of the screen and took it in to BestBuy where I bought the set three days earlier.  They said it was a definite defect and I should bring it back in.  After trying to locate another they determined every store in their system was sold out.  I then went to Fry's and they only had four in stock.  Took it home and plugged it in...no patches.  It looked great even on factory settings.  The 3D is very close to theater quality.  I love the motion flow.  Sony uses a very bright backlight to get vivid colors so you may have to turn it down a bit.  The netflix button is very handy.  I also love that when you're browsing youtube on your phone you can broadcast it to your tv to make video selection a little easier.  The phone mirroring is a very fun feature that I get a lot of use out of.  The sony entertainment network button has lots of short fun clips and interesting apps to look at but I haven't spent a lot of time looking through them.There are only things I can say negative about this tv.  One is when comparing to the LG's or Samsungs in the same range Sony has fewer bells and whistles.  Not a huge deal, but a voice search and better web browser would put this set over the top.  Two is when switching to 3D the resolution suffers a bit.  You can see lines in the screen so things aren't as silky smooth when comparing to normal 1080p.  I've tried playing a few video games in 3D but can only do it for short periods of time.  When turning side to side the graphics can look pretty jittery.Overall this tv has a great Sony screen with lots of extras for under $1000.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  Great Picture, Easy Set Up!
Reviews.Author: A Pfeifer
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer...we have had the TV 2 days...WIth that said, the TV arrived well packaged and damage free.  The deliver company unpacked the TV and tested to ensure at least the power work.  I spent quite a bit of time researching 50 inch TV and narrowed it down to the Sony Bravia. I am a big fan of Samsung, but the picture and price of the Bravia could not be ignored.  This is our everyday TV located in our living room.  The picture is somewhat darker than the 42 inch LG TV we were replacing.  Which is great for us because we watch most of our favorite sporting events on this TV and the darker contrast is fantastic.  Easy to track the actual baseball, football and hockey puck during games.  Our son has his Playstation connect to this TV as well and the image is outstanding.The TV was very easy to set up.Time, date, and internet took less than 5 minutes.The TV is light and easy to handle.The remote is simple and clean.Sound quality is fine, not great, but fine for our location and usage.If I could change anything (and it's a small thing) I wish the power cord was slightly longer.48 hours in and we love it

Reviews.Title: Simply Terrific
Reviews.Author: Viktor Votsch
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but I figured I'd fill in some blanks I wasn't sure about from the other reviews I read (which I found to be extremely helpful btw).Its a terrific picture right out of the box.  I had read some things about Xbox and Sony not playing well together but I had no such problems.  Also, I read some reviews about screen lag when gaming.  I am not a huge gamer but I play enough.  I did notice something just slightly off.  I tried the game mode  the TV has that changes some of the motion settings and that worked great for me.I haven't messed with the 3D yet, the technology just doesn't interest me that much.  But the picture on high end sources like a blue ray version of The Hobbit are truly amazing.  The only downside of the picture being so great is that I've been sucked into watching way too much pre-season football so far because it looks so good.I was upgrading from an older sony to this one and one of the nice side benefits was my universal remote worked without a single change needed.  This was key because the remote provided by sony for this TV is pretty weak.Besides the remote, I really don't have anything negative to say.  The picture is gorgeous out the box but has tons of tweaks and adjustments you could make if you are so inclined.  Sports, games and movies all look terrific.  Has all the modern inputs and was extremely easy to setup.I chose this model over some similarly priced Samsung and Vizio models.  I don't know how those models might have worked out for me but I don't have a single second thought about this one.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV
Reviews.Author: ruthie
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful TV.  The picture is sharp and clear, the color beautiful.  The special features are very good.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for a new TV.

Reviews.Title: Best 2013 70" TV
Reviews.Author: Bama
Reviews.Content: I recently went through the process of ordering a Samsung PN64F8500 from Amazon. Unfortunately I confirmed that I am one of the few people that are sensitive to plasma trails and flicker. The TV was perfect, great picture but I just could not watch it. More than 30 minutes of viewing any content and headaches etc started. I already knew I had issues with DLP tech but was hoping that the newer Plasma would work. Back to Amazon it went.  Amazon was great with the return and made it painless.Since my eyes are not bothered by LCD/LED tech, I ordered the 70" KDL-70RR550A from Amazon. It was delivered from Amazon two days early. The Air Freight Company showed up within the stated window, unboxed, attached the pedestal and placed it on the stand. They patiently waited while I connected the HDMI, LAN, and Antenna cables so I could check out the set.I am coming from a Toshiba Regza full array local dimming set with great blacks. The R550 holds it's own in that regard. I have noticed no flash lighting, edge light bleed, or banding. DSE is not noticeable nor have I noticed any lack of uniformity. The out of the box custom setting with ECO sensor disabled is very accurate.I decided to dust off the i1Pro and Calman and check the new 70' R550 out. First up was a check of Custom/Warm at out of the box settings. 48fL, Greyscale with errors all well below a delta E of 3, a very flat gamma of 2.2, primaries all pretty close, and two out of the three secondaries spot on with the third fairly close. Color temperature was almost at D6500 erring slightly to the warm side. I ran through again selecting Custom/Neutral and found that the Color Temperature had jumped to around 9500 which of course made the Greyscale go way out of whack. However the Color and Gamma were still quite good.For viewing in our house I dialed back the lumens a bit to around 42fL. I adjusted Contrast/Picture to just below where clipping was observed. Brightness did not need to be adjusted as the 50 setting was spot on. Red was adjusted using a 100% red field to 21% of the 100% white field per REC709. All in all very few adjustments were required and the ones that were required were very small.For those that might be interested in how my settings compare:Custom/WarmBacklight 3Picture 94Brightness 50Color 49Hue 0Sharpness MinNoise/Mpeg Off & Motion Flow StandardAdvanced Settings all off, gamma 0The Sony 70R550A holds up very well considering the lack of Greyscale or CMS adjustments...3D is passive on this set and works very well.  I checked out a bit of Avatar in 3D and Sony has done a excellent job with passive 3D implementation.Finally a screen ratio of 2.35:1 is truly emersive!A couple of Cons:Smart TV features work well but are slow to load.Because there is so much screen real estate some motion control is necessary.  Otherwise screen blurring can be evident with slow pans.  MotionFlow set to Standard handles this nicely.  I only list this as a con because some "purists" want no motion control at all.Very nice bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: Very Good 70" TV
Reviews.Author: KR
Reviews.Content: I'm replacing Sony KDL-60EX645 which I hated. I have compared 3 other 70" Sharp TV's and this one's picture is a lot better also to mention sound is amazing too even I use sound system but found out for some regular shows it is load and clear.I gave it 4 star because of Sony SEN Internet apps and interface is super slow but when you get to your app it works just fine.Menu's also can be more intuitive and look kind of outdated also for a TV with browser and lots of apps it worth to have at least capability to add qerty keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Simply an amazing picture
Reviews.Author: pseudosavant
Reviews.Content: Just upgraded from my 52" Samsung LCD to this Sony and the picture is amazing. I knew it would be bigger (obviously) but the picture quality is just so much better than I could have expected compared to the Samsung unit that is only a few years old. Usually when you make a picture bigger it is much easier to notice the video source artifacts from compression, but the video processing on this display is just superb.Went up on my wall-mount with no issues. But if you did want to use the stand, it is actually a noticeably good looking stand, surprisingly enough.I haven't tried the 3D with any real 3D content, but the simulated 3D was surprisingly good too with games and TV content. Really nice that it includes 4 pairs of glasses in the box. I love that the TV uses passive 3D technology instead of active. It is what the theaters use, doesn't give people headaches as bad, the glasses weight less, the glasses are really cheap ($10 for Sony brand ones), and they don't have any batteries that run out.Setup was very easy. Connected to my WiFi without issue. Performed a firmware update shortly after that.Basically, this TV is what you'd expect to get for ~$2700. Fortunately for me I got it on an unbelievable sale locally.

Reviews.Title: Great price, quality / some false advertising
Reviews.Author: C. Gardner "SgtCheeseNOLS"
Reviews.Content: The good: This TV is HUGE. It does a great job in projecting 3D movies and games. Everything from sports, to drama, to sci fi shows, to video games look amazing on this TV. I'm used to owning plasmas, but with the supply dwindling as of recent years, I decided to try an LED tv. I was not disappointed. There are a lot of great features about this TV, including the Smart TV capabilities.The bad: I feel like Sony lied to the consumer when they said it supports Screen Mirroring, which implies I can mirror my iPhone or Android device. What I didn't realize until later (and it is on several Sony related forums) is that it ONLY supports Sony related technology for mirroring. The Smart TV functions are also very laggy, as if I'm using a slow computer. Roku and a video game console are much better for this. Sony also advertises an "Auto-on" for their products with the TV...that it will detect if a system (such as a Playstation) is turned on, and the TV will turn on automatically. Unfortunately, this doesn't work on Playstation 4...a Sony product!For as expensive as Sony TVs are, you would expect them to fully support everything and stand behind their advertising...but they haven't. Their official forums are littered with people making complaints, and Sony employees giving the typical legal bs about why it isn't working...rather than telling the consumer they will create a software update to address the issue.Overall, I'm happy with the TV. VERY happy...just don't get it for the side items they advertise, as they haven't worked for me and thousands of other people.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Calop
Reviews.Content: I am happy with my puchase of this 60" LED 3D TV. Light weight, plenty of hdmi ports, excellent picture. What can you say, it's a Sony. I've bought Sony TV's for more years than I want to admit and do not regret any purchase of such. The price on this one was great. Very competitive. Some of the reviews I read complained about white spots, however I have not had this problem at all. Been using it for almost two months. Remote is nothing exciting, but it does the job. Buttons are basic and straight to the point. Makes it easier when your eyesight isn't the best.

Reviews.Title: Flashlighting and Clouding backlight ruin a decent set
Reviews.Author: D. Chen
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on a black Friday sale.Overall good price for a 70". So why 2 stars you ask? Well I uploaded a few images you can take a look at in the user uploaded section from the forums (including my own set). The Backlighting on this TV is HORRIBLE. Many people won't notice it in a lit room, but watch a dark scene in a dark room and you'll see what those pictures show. Excessive clouding and flash lighting. Apparently Sony has really cut down on quality to hit these price points. Don't count on their crappy customer service to do anything either. All they do is send out a tech to replace a board that will fix nothing. It's a shame because why wouldn't you want to show off the cinematic prowess of a 70" set?Now the partial good news. You can massage the screen a bit to move the clouding to the sides. However it will not get rid of the excessive flash lighting on the side. So buy this set at your own peril. You might get lucky and get one that doesn't have as much.Unless you get a killer deal on this set I would say avoid at all costs. There are better options out there. It's a shame because some elements of this tv were a nice upgrade from my NX810.

Reviews.Title: Excellent set, for the price.
Reviews.Author: phIL
Reviews.Content: Excellent set, for the price.I will start by saying that the five star rating is based on value. A value of combining design and price point.This set offers very good picture quality. Good sound. Tons of features that you usually only find on sets over $2,000. Wireless connectivity that actually works. Passive 3D and the fact that after all it's a SONY.You can do allot better for it's retail price of  $1,400. However this 50" set was purchased for just over $900. When comparing from that perspective this is a great five star purchase.I've owned the set just shy of three weeks. I have no issues to report. Everything works as advertised.If you can grab one at these price levels, don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: Don't wait buy it now
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: Another quality Sony product. Absolutely great picture especially connected to our Sony blue-ray player/home theater. Everything sync'd perfectly right out of the box. Waited a couple of years to replace our plasma TV and after viewing our first movie wished I hadn't waited so long.

Reviews.Title: Best TV purchase in YEARS!
Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter LOVE IT! It was delivered quickly and arrived in pristine condition. Can not WAIT to use the 3D feature to watch Avatar.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Stunning Picture - Great Features
Reviews.Author: Zolee
Reviews.Content: I got this TV in an official SONY store lately. By the way it was cheaper than here on Amazon since I paid with cash. :)I'm an IT Tech and I've been connecting my actual PCs to TVs since 1998. So I had the same purpose this time as well. Oh, just to let you know I NEVER watch TV channels...they just simply wash your brain...grrhhh.Yes, you can also call me a SONY fan since I've never bought any other brand's TV, but SONY. Therefore I'm an expert lol.Cut long story short I tested it with sport, documentary, YouTube, Sci-fi movies in Blu-Ray quality, internet browsing, etc. and the QUALITY IS JUST AMAZING! I only did some minor changes in settings and the colors and the contours are just perfect for your eyes.And finally just a thought about the more expensive SONY TVs. Yes, they have really a different processor inside and the features are also richer, but the average user has no clue about the difference. Don't get me wrong I don't judge, but unless you are picky tech geek you do not need those extras. Especially when you pick a SONY. It's like with German cars in the premium category: even the cheapest model has more features and better quality than the most expensive South Korean or Japanese cars.I had been making my research for months before I bought this TV, but I did not regret a single penny I spent on it!Good Job Again, SONY!

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: cavemen "FJC"
Reviews.Content: Overall very happy with quality with the TV. Picture is very very good. Even though I've only had it a week very happy with the quality. The internet options work very well and the  Simplicity to get on the net via WiFi, just amazing.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Yongdae Kim
Reviews.Content: This TV is what I'm looking for!!Nice visual quality, also audio too.Movie OK, Game OK, Apple TV OK!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Rem
Reviews.Content: I was debating between samsung 8000 series and this TV. Former is about 7K. After reading the reviews for this tv I took the plunge and am I happy that I did that!. This is an excellent TV. Price is really good also. Picture quality is superb, I did not have to tweak any settings (as opposed to Sharp, which I was contemplating, where again and again common theme had been to tweak the settings). "Soap Opera effect" is there but not really bothersome (to me). My only gripe, if I may, is that the processor is a bit slow and it takes may be a few seconds more to load internet content (not a deal breaker by any means). Finally Amazon never fails to meet my expectations. delivery was on time and superb, the guys set it up in no time (no extra cost).

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Gaming / Sports
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: Just got this TV since the Football (American) season started up. Went to Best Buy to check out a few, messed with all the color settings and it looks great. You can really tell on the cheaper 60" when there are gradients. They turn into huge stripes. This one seems to handle gradients fine.Mostly writing this review to let people know that until there is a software update the Miracast support is terrible. They do not support actual Miracast (which makes me question how they can call this Miracast). So your Windows 8.1 laptop with wireless display built in, or any laptop with Miracast installed will not work! Very disappointed when Sony's support informed me of this.I really enjoy this TV because of the quality and the overall look (very modern with minimal bezel). Would have been a 5/5 if it were not for the half supported Miracast. I guess the Xbox One will have it so that will solve that issue in a few months. Great for gaming by the way on the current Xbox.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Reger
Reviews.Content: I just received this on 8/19/13, so I've not had very much time with it. So far, I couldn't be happier. This is a great TV at a great price. I paid more than twice as much for my top of the line 40" a few years ago and this one has far more to offer. The free year of Netflix and Hulu+ is a tremendous bonus. The delivery went great, though only one guy showed up and I had to help him. The TV was packaged with extreme care to prevent damage. At first I thought they'd sent me the next size up by mistake, but it was actually packed inside a larger box filled with stuffing. It was quickly set up and I've been enjoying it non stop ever since. It was hard to go to bed tonight.

Reviews.Title: Great Tv
Reviews.Author: Dotun B. Ayansina
Reviews.Content: The tv is of very good quality. The image processing is good and the colors are vivid. The browser is good but it needs a proper keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: OWG
Reviews.Content: I really love this HDTV. However, the "free" add-ons for Hulu plus and Netflix were hard to validate and took many hours of tracking down the offers as listed by Sony.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture!!
Reviews.Author: Levar Washington
Reviews.Content: I moved up from a Sony 40" to this tv. Once calibrated...the picture is stunning no back light bleed or clouding. The blacks look good. I'm sure plasma is better with the blacks, but who cares. 3d looks great also. I did notice crosstalk. But it was minimal. I haven't seen any 3d tv that was perfect at 3d. I can't use my Note 3 to stream or screen mirror videos or images to the tv. You can only use sony phones which sucks. One of the reasons. I upgraded my tv was for dlna support. My Internet is wired to the tv. But netflix 3d movies still freeze. I will update this since I don't know if this is a netflix or sony issue. Otherwise...the tv is great 4 stars!! Oh and gaming with this tv is good also. Once you set the scene to game mode...the response time is excellent.

Reviews.Title: The picture on a Sony says it all!!
Reviews.Author: Dorothye L. Chambers
Reviews.Content: Great picture!  Have had Sony TV's for years.  Purchased a 47" internet sony about 2yrs ago. My guest constantly state how vivid the picture is.  Don't have to recommend, the picture says it all.

Reviews.Title: very nice set
Reviews.Author: Lois Zillges
Reviews.Content: The tv met my expectations in all respects.  Picture quality is good, but not as bright and sharp as some other brands, notably samsung.  This was expected as I wanted a matt screen because of the bright room in which it is located.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: leibnitz
Reviews.Content: this is the presentation screen for our board room now. it is bright and clear, and works with windows 7 just great.

Reviews.Title: Sony
Reviews.Author: LONNIE STYRON
Reviews.Content: Meets my high expectations.  Replaced 20 year old Sony that is still excellant. I am very happy with this TV.  Lonnie

Reviews.Title: I love SONY...but I want calibration measure figures.
Reviews.Author: ChoJinsung
Reviews.Content: I received this item and I am very happy to have it. And to optimize this Tv, I want to calibrate it..If anyone has this TV's calibration measures, please share with me.. Have a good Day~

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is great sound is great some of the other 3D modes are a bit confusing like the side by side and over under effects.

Reviews.Title: Samsung or Sony???
Reviews.Author: Junior
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv from Pricemart. not Amazon after spending a number of days doing research before buying, looked at Samsung as well with apps. A television is as good as the picture quality (HD content), and Sony delivers.This is a new model so you can expect bugs, but with software updates it can only get better. I am very please with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-60R550A 60 Inch 120Hz 1080p LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Mike Russell
Reviews.Content: We love this tv.  It is definitely the best we have had yet.  Great pictureand definitely not too big.

Reviews.Title: screen mirroring and mhl
Reviews.Author: sonny
Reviews.Content: I would not buy a sony if you plan to use and connect it with a samsung cellphone or with any other cellphone brand except a sony xperia!! The screen mirroring will not work and the hdmi with mhl port doesn't work either. I bought a sony hdmi to micro usb cable and the tv does not detect my samsung galaxy s4 and won't even charge my cellphone!! This tv's connectovity with other brands of cellphones sucks. SONY TV'S ONLY WORK WITH THEIR XPERIA CELLPHONES!!! But to be fair, i'm upgrading the stars to 4. Thanks for the update.UPDATE03 April 2014just had a software update and all i couls say is great!!! Screen mirroring now works for both my samsung s4 and my wife's samsung s3!!! What took you so long,sony?! Why did you have to wait for thousands of complaints to come up on this model before you fixed the issue?!
